trivia_items.text: She is named after a powerful fire jinn in Islamic mythology. Indeed, it fits well to her fire-based attacks and her Diablo traits.
sub_items: A figure of smoke and flame that resembles Ifrit's namesake is also present in her Elite 2 artwork, as well as when she uses Scorched Earth, likely to represent her Diabolus consciousness.
Ifrit is often depicted as a lizard-like creature in modern fantasy works which fits her original race as a Savra.

trivia_items.text: Along with Amiya, Ifrit has the highest Cell-Originium Assimilation of all Infected characters, at 19%.

Up until the introduction of Corroserum, Ifrit has had the distinction of having the longest period of time of being the sole member of her class' branch (in her case, the Blast Caster) ever since the release of Arknights, for a total of over two years. Aak would later beat her as being alone for over four years up until the introduction of Spuria.
Of all 6â˜… Operators added in the release of Arknights, Ifrit is the last one to receive English dialogues.

Ifrit posesses the highest amount of RES debuff a sole operator can have, namely 40 percentual at Elite 2 (44 when her potentials are added to it) and 20 flat in her third skill. There is no other operator who can reach that amount on their own.
